s0041.chinese: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。
s0041.literal: When Gaozu became noble, then he did not know the old man's whereabouts.
s0041.idiomatic: After Gaozu rose to power, he lost track of where the old man had gone.

s0042.chinese: 高祖為亭長，乃鲈竹皮為冠，令求盜之薛治，時時冠之，及貴常冠，所謂「劉氏冠」也。
s0042.literal: Gaozu as pavilion chief, then made a crown from bamboo skin, had the thief-catching Xue make it, wore it from time to time, and when noble constantly wore it, what is called 'Liu clan crown'.
s0042.idiomatic: When Gaozu was a local sheriff, he had a crown made from bamboo bark and asked Xue, the thief-catcher, to make it. He wore it occasionally then, and continued wearing it after becoming emperor. This became known as the 'Liu family crown.'

s0043.chinese: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒驪山，徒多道亡。
s0043.literal: Gaozu as pavilion chief was ordered by the county to send convicts to Lishan, the convicts mostly fled on the way.
s0043.idiomatic: As sheriff, Gaozu was assigned by the county to escort convicts to Mount Li. Most of the prisoners escaped along the way.

s0044.chinese: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中亭，止飲，夜皆解縱所送徒。
s0044.literal: He himself estimated that by the time they arrived all would have fled, arrived at the pavilion in the marsh west of Feng, stopped to drink, at night all untied and released the convicts they were escorting.
s0044.idiomatic: He figured that by the time they reached their destination, all the prisoners would have escaped anyway. They stopped at a pavilion in the western marshes of Feng for a drink, and that night he untied them all and let them go.

s0046.chinese: 公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」
s0046.literal: You gentlemen all go, I also from here will depart!'
s0046.idiomatic: You gentlemen go your way. I'll disappear from here too!'
